basOspf.name: basOspf
basOspf.contactinfo: Tech Support Broadband Access Systems 201 Forest Street Marlboro, MA 01752 U.S.A. 508-485-8200 support@basystems.com
basOspf.description: This module defines the MIB objects for a Broadband Access System IP Forwarding component.

Status.name: Status
Status.description: The status of an interface: 'enabled' indicates that it is willing to communicate with other OSPF Routers, while 'disabled' indicates that it is not.

PositiveInteger.name: PositiveInteger
PositiveInteger.description: A positive integer. Values in excess are precluded as unnecessary and prone to interoperability issues.

HelloRange.name: HelloRange
HelloRange.description: The range of intervals on which hello messages are exchanged.

UpToMaxAge.name: UpToMaxAge
UpToMaxAge.description: The values that one might find or configure for variables bounded by the maximum age of an LSA.

DesignatedRouterPriority.name: DesignatedRouterPriority
DesignatedRouterPriority.description: The values defined for the priority of a system for becoming the designated router.

TOSType.name: TOSType
TOSType.description: Type of Service is defined as a mapping to the IP Type of Service Flags as defined in the IP Forwarding Table MIB +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+ | | | | | PRECEDENCE | TYPE OF SERVICE | 0 | | | | | +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+ IP TOS IP TOS Field Policy Field Policy Contents Code Contents Code 0 0 0 0 ==> 0 0 0 0 1 ==> 2 0 0 1 0 ==> 4 0 0 1 1 ==> 6 0 1 0 0 ==> 8 0 1 0 1 ==> 10 0 1 1 0 ==> 12 0 1 1 1 ==> 14 1 0 0 0 ==> 16 1 0 0 1 ==> 18 1 0 1 0 ==> 20 1 0 1 1 ==> 22 1 1 0 0 ==> 24 1 1 0 1 ==> 26 1 1 1 0 ==> 28 1 1 1 1 ==> 30 The remaining values are left for future definition.

basOspfGeneralGroupTable.name: basOspfGeneralGroupTable
basOspfGeneralGroupTable.description: A list of Route Server forwarding table distribution mechanism statistics.

basOspfRouterId.name: basOspfRouterId
basOspfRouterId.description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the router in the Autonomous System. By convention, to ensure uniqueness, this should default to the value of one of the router's IP interface addresses.

basOspfAdminStat.name: basOspfAdminStat
basOspfAdminStat.description: The administrative status of OSPF in the router. The value 'enabled' denotes that the OSPF Process is active on at least one inter- face; 'disabled' disables it on all inter- faces.

basOspfVersionNumber.name: basOspfVersionNumber
basOspfVersionNumber.description: The current version number of the OSPF proto- col is 2.

basOspfAreaBdrRtrStatus.name: basOspfAreaBdrRtrStatus
basOspfAreaBdrRtrStatus.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 3 Splitting the AS into Areas
basOspfAreaBdrRtrStatus.description: A flag to note whether this router is an area border router.

basOspfASBdrRtrStatus.name: basOspfASBdrRtrStatus
basOspfASBdrRtrStatus.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 3.3 Classification of routers
basOspfASBdrRtrStatus.description: A flag to note whether this router is config- ured as an Autonomous System border router.

basOspfExternLsaCount.name: basOspfExternLsaCount
basOspfExternLsaCount.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix A.4.5 AS external link advertisements
basOspfExternLsaCount.description: The number of external (LS type 5) link-state advertisements in the link-state database.

basOspfExternLsaCksumSum.name: basOspfExternLsaCksumSum
basOspfExternLsaCksumSum.description: The 32-bit unsigned sum of the LS checksums of the external link-state advertisements con- tained in the link-state database. This sum can be used to determine if there has been a change in a router's link state database, and to compare the link-state database of two routers.

basOspfTOSSupport.name: basOspfTOSSupport
basOspfTOSSupport.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix F.1.2 Optional TOS support
basOspfTOSSupport.description: The router's support for type-of-service rout- ing.

basOspfOriginateNewLsas.name: basOspfOriginateNewLsas
basOspfOriginateNewLsas.description: The number of new link-state advertisements that have been originated. This number is in- cremented each time the router originates a new LSA.

basOspfRxNewLsas.name: basOspfRxNewLsas
basOspfRxNewLsas.description: The number of link-state advertisements re- ceived determined to be new instantiations. This number does not include newer instantia- tions of self-originated link-state advertise- ments.

basOspfExtLsdbLimit.name: basOspfExtLsdbLimit
basOspfExtLsdbLimit.description: The maximum number of non-default AS- external-LSAs entries that can be stored in the link-state database. If the value is -1, then there is no limit. When the number of non-default AS-external-LSAs in a router's link-state database reaches ospfExtLsdbLimit, the router enters Overflow- State. The router never holds more than ospfExtLsdbLimit non-default AS-external-LSAs in its database. OspfExtLsdbLimit MUST be set identically in all routers attached to the OSPF backbone and/or any regular OSPF area. (i.e., OSPF stub areas and NSSAs are excluded).

basOspfMulticastExtensions.name: basOspfMulticastExtensions
basOspfMulticastExtensions.description: A Bit Mask indicating whether the router is forwarding IP multicast (Class D) datagrams based on the algorithms defined in the Multi- cast Extensions to OSPF. Bit 0, if set, indicates that the router can forward IP multicast datagrams in the router's directly attached areas (called intra-area mul- ticast routing). Bit 1, if set, indicates that the router can forward IP multicast datagrams between OSPF areas (called inter-area multicast routing). Bit 2, if set, indicates that the router can forward IP multicast datagrams between Auto- nomous Systems (called inter-AS multicast rout- ing). Only certain combinations of bit settings are allowed, namely: 0 (no multicast forwarding is enabled), 1 (intra-area multicasting only), 3 (intra-area and inter-area multicasting), 5 (intra-area and inter-AS multicasting) and 7 (multicasting everywhere). By default, no mul- ticast forwarding is enabled.

basOspfExitOverflowInterval.name: basOspfExitOverflowInterval
basOspfExitOverflowInterval.description: The number of seconds that, after entering OverflowState, a router will attempt to leave OverflowState. This allows the router to again originate non-default AS-external-LSAs. When set to 0, the router will not leave Overflow- State until restarted.

basOspfDemandExtensions.name: basOspfDemandExtensions
basOspfDemandExtensions.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix on Demand Routing
basOspfDemandExtensions.description: The router's support for demand routing.

basOspfGeneralGroupChassis.name: basOspfGeneralGroupChassis
basOspfGeneralGroupChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfGeneralGroupSlot.name: basOspfGeneralGroupSlot
basOspfGeneralGroupSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfGeneralGroupIf.name: basOspfGeneralGroupIf
basOspfGeneralGroupIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfGeneralGroupLPort.name: basOspfGeneralGroupLPort
basOspfGeneralGroupLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basOspfAreaTable.name: basOspfAreaTable
basOspfAreaTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 6 The Area Data Struc- ture
basOspfAreaTable.description: Information describing the configured parame- ters and cumulative statistics of the router's attached areas.

basOspfAreaEntry.name: basOspfAreaEntry
basOspfAreaEntry.description: Information describing the configured parame- ters and cumulative statistics of one of the router's attached areas.

basOspfAreaId.name: basOspfAreaId
basOspfAreaId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2 Area parameters
basOspfAreaId.description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying an area. Area ID 0.0.0.0 is used for the OSPF backbone.

basOspfAuthType.name: basOspfAuthType
basOspfAuthType.description: The authentication type specified for an area. Additional authentication types may be assigned locally on a per Area basis.

basOspfImportAsExtern.name: basOspfImportAsExtern
basOspfImportAsExtern.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2 Area parameters
basOspfImportAsExtern.description: The area's support for importing AS external link- state advertisements.

basOspfSpfRuns.name: basOspfSpfRuns
basOspfSpfRuns.description: The number of times that the intra-area route table has been calculated using this area's link-state database. This is typically done using Dijkstra's algorithm.

basOspfAreaBdrRtrCount.name: basOspfAreaBdrRtrCount
basOspfAreaBdrRtrCount.description: The total number of area border routers reach- able within this area. This is initially zero, and is calculated in each SPF Pass.

basOspfAsBdrRtrCount.name: basOspfAsBdrRtrCount
basOspfAsBdrRtrCount.description: The total number of Autonomous System border routers reachable within this area. This is initially zero, and is calculated in each SPF Pass.

basOspfAreaLsaCount.name: basOspfAreaLsaCount
basOspfAreaLsaCount.description: The total number of link-state advertisements in this area's link-state database, excluding AS External LSA's.

basOspfAreaLsaCksumSum.name: basOspfAreaLsaCksumSum
basOspfAreaLsaCksumSum.description: The 32-bit unsigned sum of the link-state ad- vertisements' LS checksums contained in this area's link-state database. This sum excludes external (LS type 5) link-state advertisements. The sum can be used to determine if there has been a change in a router's link state data- base, and to compare the link-state database of two routers.

basOspfAreaSummary.name: basOspfAreaSummary
basOspfAreaSummary.description: The variable ospfAreaSummary controls the im- port of summary LSAs into stub areas. It has no effect on other areas. If it is noAreaSummary, the router will neither originate nor propagate summary LSAs into the stub area. It will rely entirely on its de- fault route. If it is sendAreaSummary, the router will both summarize and propagate summary LSAs.

basOspfAreaStatus.name: basOspfAreaStatus
basOspfAreaStatus.description: This variable displays the status of the en- try. Setting it to 'invalid' has the effect of rendering it inoperative. The internal effect (row removal) is implementation dependent.

basOspfAreaChassis.name: basOspfAreaChassis
basOspfAreaChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfAreaSlot.name: basOspfAreaSlot
basOspfAreaSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfAreaIf.name: basOspfAreaIf
basOspfAreaIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfAreaLPort.name: basOspfAreaLPort
basOspfAreaLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basOspfStubAreaTable.name: basOspfStubAreaTable
basOspfStubAreaTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2, Area Parameters
basOspfStubAreaTable.description: The set of metrics that will be advertised by a default Area Border Router into a stub area.

basOspfStubAreaEntry.name: basOspfStubAreaEntry
basOspfStubAreaEntry.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2, Area Parameters
basOspfStubAreaEntry.description: The metric for a given Type of Service that will be advertised by a default Area Border Router into a stub area.

basOspfStubAreaId.name: basOspfStubAreaId
basOspfStubAreaId.description: The 32 bit identifier for the Stub Area. On creation, this can be derived from the in- stance.

basOspfStubTOS.name: basOspfStubTOS
basOspfStubTOS.description: The Type of Service associated with the metric. On creation, this can be derived from the instance.

basOspfStubMetric.name: basOspfStubMetric
basOspfStubMetric.description: The metric value applied at the indicated type of service. By default, this equals the least metric at the type of service among the inter- faces to other areas.

basOspfStubStatus.name: basOspfStubStatus
basOspfStubStatus.description: This variable displays the status of the en- try. Setting it to 'invalid' has the effect of rendering it inoperative. The internal effect (row removal) is implementation dependent.

basOspfStubMetricType.name: basOspfStubMetricType
basOspfStubMetricType.description: This variable displays the type of metric ad- vertised as a default route.

basOspfStubAreaChassis.name: basOspfStubAreaChassis
basOspfStubAreaChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfStubAreaSlot.name: basOspfStubAreaSlot
basOspfStubAreaSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfStubAreaIf.name: basOspfStubAreaIf
basOspfStubAreaIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfStubAreaLPort.name: basOspfStubAreaLPort
basOspfStubAreaLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basOspfLsdbTable.name: basOspfLsdbTable
basOspfLsdbTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12 Link State Adver- tisements
basOspfLsdbTable.description: The OSPF Process's Link State Database.

basOspfLsdbAreaId.name: basOspfLsdbAreaId
basOspfLsdbAreaId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2 Area parameters
basOspfLsdbAreaId.description: The 32 bit identifier of the Area from which the LSA was received.

basOspfLsdbType.name: basOspfLsdbType
basOspfLsdbType.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix A.4.1 The Link State Advertisement header
basOspfLsdbType.description: The type of the link state advertisement. Each link state type has a separate advertise- ment format.

basOspfLsdbLsid.name: basOspfLsdbLsid
basOspfLsdbLsid.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.4 Link State ID
basOspfLsdbLsid.description: The Link State ID is an LS Type Specific field containing either a Router ID or an IP Address; it identifies the piece of the routing domain that is being described by the advertisement.

basOspfLsdbRouterId.name: basOspfLsdbRouterId
basOspfLsdbRouterId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.1 Global parameters
basOspfLsdbRouterId.description: The 32 bit number that uniquely identifies the originating router in the Autonomous System.

basOspfLsdbSequence.name: basOspfLsdbSequence
basOspfLsdbSequence.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.6 LS sequence number
basOspfLsdbSequence.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It is used to detect old and dupli- cate link state advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number the more recent the advertisement.

basOspfLsdbAge.name: basOspfLsdbAge
basOspfLsdbAge.description: This field is the age of the link state adver- tisement in seconds.

basOspfLsdbChecksum.name: basOspfLsdbChecksum
basOspfLsdbChecksum.description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum. The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connec- tionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum.

basOspfLsdbAdvertisement.name: basOspfLsdbAdvertisement
basOspfLsdbAdvertisement.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12 Link State Adver- tisements
basOspfLsdbAdvertisement.description: The entire Link State Advertisement, including its header.

basOspfLsdbChassis.name: basOspfLsdbChassis
basOspfLsdbChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfLsdbSlot.name: basOspfLsdbSlot
basOspfLsdbSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfLsdbIf.name: basOspfLsdbIf
basOspfLsdbIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfLsdbLPort.name: basOspfLsdbLPort
basOspfLsdbLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basOspfHostTable.name: basOspfHostTable
basOspfHostTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.6 Host route param- eters
basOspfHostTable.description: The list of Hosts, and their metrics, that the router will advertise as host routes.

basOspfHostEntry.name: basOspfHostEntry
basOspfHostEntry.description: A metric to be advertised, for a given type of service, when a given host is reachable.

basOspfHostIpAddress.name: basOspfHostIpAddress
basOspfHostIpAddress.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.6 Host route parame- ters
basOspfHostIpAddress.description: The IP Address of the Host.

basOspfHostTOS.name: basOspfHostTOS
basOspfHostTOS.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.6 Host route parame- ters
basOspfHostTOS.description: The Type of Service of the route being config- ured.

basOspfHostMetric.name: basOspfHostMetric
basOspfHostMetric.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.6 Host route parame- ters

basOspfHostStatus.name: basOspfHostStatus
basOspfHostStatus.description: This variable displays the status of the en- try. Setting it to 'invalid' has the effect of rendering it inoperative. The internal effect (row removal) is implementation dependent.

basOspfHostAreaID.name: basOspfHostAreaID
basOspfHostAreaID.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2 Area parameters
basOspfHostAreaID.description: The Area the Host Entry is to be found within. By default, the area that a subsuming OSPF in- terface is in, or 0.0.0.0

basOspfHostChassis.name: basOspfHostChassis
basOspfHostChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfHostSlot.name: basOspfHostSlot
basOspfHostSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfHostIf.name: basOspfHostIf
basOspfHostIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfHostLPort.name: basOspfHostLPort
basOspfHostLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basOspfIfTable.name: basOspfIfTable
basOspfIfTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.3 Router interface parameters
basOspfIfTable.description: The OSPF Interface Table describes the inter- faces from the viewpoint of OSPF.

basOspfIfEntry.name: basOspfIfEntry
basOspfIfEntry.description: The OSPF Interface Entry describes one inter- face from the viewpoint of OSPF.

basOspfIfIpAddress.name: basOspfIfIpAddress
basOspfIfIpAddress.description: The IP address of this OSPF interface.

basOspfAddressLessIf.name: basOspfAddressLessIf
basOspfAddressLessIf.description: For the purpose of easing the instancing of addressed and addressless interfaces; This variable takes the value 0 on interfaces with IP Addresses, and the corresponding value of ifIndex for interfaces having no IP Address.

basOspfIfAreaId.name: basOspfIfAreaId
basOspfIfAreaId.description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the area to which the interface connects. Area ID 0.0.0.0 is used for the OSPF backbone.

basOspfIfType.name: basOspfIfType
basOspfIfType.description: The OSPF interface type. By way of a default, this field may be intuited from the corresponding value of ifType. Broad- cast LANs, such as Ethernet and IEEE 802.5, take the value 'broadcast', X.25 and similar technologies take the value 'nbma', and links that are definitively point to point take the value 'pointToPoint'.

basOspfIfAdminStat.name: basOspfIfAdminStat
basOspfIfAdminStat.description: The OSPF interface's administrative status. The value formed on the interface, and the in- terface will be advertised as an internal route to some area. The value 'disabled' denotes that the interface is external to OSPF.

basOspfIfRtrPriority.name: basOspfIfRtrPriority
basOspfIfRtrPriority.description: The priority of this interface. Used in multi-access networks, this field is used in the designated router election algorithm. The value 0 signifies that the router is not eligi- ble to become the designated router on this particular network. In the event of a tie in this value, routers will use their Router ID as a tie breaker.

basOspfIfTransitDelay.name: basOspfIfTransitDelay
basOspfIfTransitDelay.description: The estimated number of seconds it takes to transmit a link state update packet over this interface.

basOspfIfRetransInterval.name: basOspfIfRetransInterval
basOspfIfRetransInterval.description: The number of seconds between link-state ad- vertisement retransmissions, for adjacencies belonging to this interface. This value is also used when retransmitting database descrip- tion and link-state request packets.

basOspfIfHelloInterval.name: basOspfIfHelloInterval
basOspfIfHelloInterval.description: The length of time, in seconds, between the Hello packets that the router sends on the in- terface. This value must be the same for all routers attached to a common network.

basOspfIfRtrDeadInterval.name: basOspfIfRtrDeadInterval
basOspfIfRtrDeadInterval.description: The number of seconds that a router's Hello packets have not been seen before it's neigh- bors declare the router down. This should be some multiple of the Hello interval. This value must be the same for all routers attached to a common network.

basOspfIfPollInterval.name: basOspfIfPollInterval
basOspfIfPollInterval.description: The larger time interval, in seconds, between the Hello packets sent to an inactive non- broadcast multi- access neighbor.

basOspfIfDesignatedRouter.name: basOspfIfDesignatedRouter
basOspfIfDesignatedRouter.description: The IP Address of the Designated Router.

basOspfIfBackupDesignatedRouter.name: basOspfIfBackupDesignatedRouter
basOspfIfBackupDesignatedRouter.description: The IP Address of the Backup Designated Router.

basOspfIfEvents.name: basOspfIfEvents
basOspfIfEvents.description: The number of times this OSPF interface has changed its state, or an error has occurred.

basOspfIfAuthKey.name: basOspfIfAuthKey
basOspfIfAuthKey.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 9 The Interface Data Structure
basOspfIfAuthKey.description: The Authentication Key. If the Area's Author- ization Type is simplePassword, and the key length is shorter than 8 octets, the agent will left adjust and zero fill to 8 octets. Note that unauthenticated interfaces need no authentication key, and simple password authen- tication cannot use a key of more than 8 oc- tets. Larger keys are useful only with authen- tication mechanisms not specified in this docu- ment. When read, ospfIfAuthKey always returns an Oc- tet String of length zero.

basOspfIfStatus.name: basOspfIfStatus
basOspfIfStatus.description: This variable displays the status of the en- try. Setting it to 'invalid' has the effect of rendering it inoperative. The internal effect (row removal) is implementation dependent.

basOspfIfMulticastForwarding.name: basOspfIfMulticastForwarding
basOspfIfMulticastForwarding.description: The way multicasts should forwarded on this interface; not forwarded, forwarded as data link multicasts, or forwarded as data link uni- casts. Data link multicasting is not meaning- ful on point to point and NBMA interfaces, and setting ospfMulticastForwarding to 0 effective- ly disables all multicast forwarding.

basOspfIfDemand.name: basOspfIfDemand
basOspfIfDemand.description: Indicates whether Demand OSPF procedures (hel- lo supression to FULL neighbors and setting the DoNotAge flag on proogated LSAs) should be per- formed on this interface.

basOspfIfAuthType.name: basOspfIfAuthType
basOspfIfAuthType.description: The authentication type specified for an in- terface. Additional authentication types may be assigned locally.

basOspfIfChassis.name: basOspfIfChassis
basOspfIfChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfIfSlot.name: basOspfIfSlot
basOspfIfSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfIfIf.name: basOspfIfIf
basOspfIfIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfIfLPort.name: basOspfIfLPort
basOspfIfLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basOspfIfMetricTable.name: basOspfIfMetricTable
basOspfIfMetricTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.3 Router interface parameters
basOspfIfMetricTable.description: The TOS metrics for a non-virtual interface identified by the interface index.

basOspfIfMetricEntry.name: basOspfIfMetricEntry
basOspfIfMetricEntry.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.3 Router interface parameters
basOspfIfMetricEntry.description: A particular TOS metric for a non-virtual in- terface identified by the interface index.

basOspfIfMetricIpAddress.name: basOspfIfMetricIpAddress
basOspfIfMetricIpAddress.description: The IP address of this OSPF interface. On row creation, this can be derived from the in- stance.

basOspfIfMetricAddressLessIf.name: basOspfIfMetricAddressLessIf
basOspfIfMetricAddressLessIf.description: For the purpose of easing the instancing of addressed and addressless interfaces; This variable takes the value 0 on interfaces with IP Addresses, and the value of ifIndex for in- terfaces having no IP Address. On row crea- tion, this can be derived from the instance.

basOspfIfMetricTOS.name: basOspfIfMetricTOS
basOspfIfMetricTOS.description: The type of service metric being referenced. On row creation, this can be derived from the instance.

basOspfIfMetricValue.name: basOspfIfMetricValue
basOspfIfMetricValue.description: The metric of using this type of service on this interface. The default value of the TOS 0 Metric is 10^8 / ifSpeed.

basOspfIfMetricStatus.name: basOspfIfMetricStatus
basOspfIfMetricStatus.description: This variable displays the status of the en- try. Setting it to 'invalid' has the effect of rendering it inoperative. The internal effect (row removal) is implementation dependent.

basOspfIfMetricChassis.name: basOspfIfMetricChassis
basOspfIfMetricChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfIfMetricSlot.name: basOspfIfMetricSlot
basOspfIfMetricSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfIfMetricIf.name: basOspfIfMetricIf
basOspfIfMetricIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfIfMetricLPort.name: basOspfIfMetricLPort
basOspfIfMetricLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basOspfVirtIfTable.name: basOspfVirtIfTable
basOspfVirtIfTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.4 Virtual link parameters
basOspfVirtIfTable.description: Information about this router's virtual inter- faces.

basOspfVirtIfEntry.name: basOspfVirtIfEntry
basOspfVirtIfEntry.description: Information about a single Virtual Interface.

basOspfVirtIfAreaId.name: basOspfVirtIfAreaId
basOspfVirtIfAreaId.description: The Transit Area that the Virtual Link traverses. By definition, this is not 0.0.0.0

basOspfVirtIfNeighbor.name: basOspfVirtIfNeighbor
basOspfVirtIfNeighbor.description: The Router ID of the Virtual Neighbor.

basOspfVirtIfTransitDelay.name: basOspfVirtIfTransitDelay
basOspfVirtIfTransitDelay.description: The estimated number of seconds it takes to transmit a link- state update packet over this interface.

basOspfVirtIfRetransInterval.name: basOspfVirtIfRetransInterval
basOspfVirtIfRetransInterval.description: The number of seconds between link-state ad- vertisement retransmissions, for adjacencies belonging to this interface. This value is also used when retransmitting database descrip- tion and link-state request packets. This value should be well over the expected round- trip time.

basOspfVirtIfHelloInterval.name: basOspfVirtIfHelloInterval
basOspfVirtIfHelloInterval.description: The length of time, in seconds, between the Hello packets that the router sends on the in- terface. This value must be the same for the virtual neighbor.

basOspfVirtIfRtrDeadInterval.name: basOspfVirtIfRtrDeadInterval
basOspfVirtIfRtrDeadInterval.description: The number of seconds that a router's Hello packets have not been seen before it's neigh- bors declare the router down. This should be some multiple of the Hello interval. This value must be the same for the virtual neigh- bor.

basOspfVirtIfEvents.name: basOspfVirtIfEvents
basOspfVirtIfEvents.description: The number of state changes or error events on this Virtual Link

basOspfVirtIfAuthKey.name: basOspfVirtIfAuthKey
basOspfVirtIfAuthKey.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 9 The Interface Data Structure
basOspfVirtIfAuthKey.description: If Authentication Type is simplePassword, the device will left adjust and zero fill to 8 oc- tets. Note that unauthenticated interfaces need no authentication key, and simple password authen- tication cannot use a key of more than 8 oc- tets. Larger keys are useful only with authen- tication mechanisms not specified in this docu- ment. When read, ospfVifAuthKey always returns a string of length zero.

basOspfVirtIfStatus.name: basOspfVirtIfStatus
basOspfVirtIfStatus.description: This variable displays the status of the en- try. Setting it to 'invalid' has the effect of rendering it inoperative. The internal effect (row removal) is implementation dependent.

basOspfVirtIfAuthType.name: basOspfVirtIfAuthType
basOspfVirtIfAuthType.description: The authentication type specified for a virtu- al interface. Additional authentication types may be assigned locally.

basOspfVirtIfChassis.name: basOspfVirtIfChassis
basOspfVirtIfChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfVirtIfSlot.name: basOspfVirtIfSlot
basOspfVirtIfSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfVirtIfIf.name: basOspfVirtIfIf
basOspfVirtIfIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfVirtIfLPort.name: basOspfVirtIfLPort
basOspfVirtIfLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basOspfNbrTable.name: basOspfNbrTable
basOspfNbrTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 10 The Neighbor Data Structure
basOspfNbrTable.description: A table of non-virtual neighbor information.

basOspfNbrEntry.name: basOspfNbrEntry
basOspfNbrEntry.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 10 The Neighbor Data Structure
basOspfNbrEntry.description: The information regarding a single neighbor.

basOspfNbrIpAddr.name: basOspfNbrIpAddr
basOspfNbrIpAddr.description: The IP address this neighbor is using in its IP Source Address. Note that, on addressless links, this will not be 0.0.0.0, but the ad- dress of another of the neighbor's interfaces.

basOspfNbrAddressLessIndex.name: basOspfNbrAddressLessIndex
basOspfNbrAddressLessIndex.description: On an interface having an IP Address, zero. On addressless interfaces, the corresponding value of ifIndex in the Internet Standard MIB. On row creation, this can be derived from the instance.

basOspfNbrRtrId.name: basOspfNbrRtrId
basOspfNbrRtrId.description: A 32-bit integer (represented as a type IpAd- dress) uniquely identifying the neighboring router in the Autonomous System.

basOspfNbrOptions.name: basOspfNbrOptions
basOspfNbrOptions.description: A Bit Mask corresponding to the neighbor's op- tions field. Bit 0, if set, indicates that the system will operate on Type of Service metrics other than TOS 0. If zero, the neighbor will ignore all metrics except the TOS 0 metric. Bit 1, if set, indicates that the associated area accepts and operates on external informa- tion; if zero, it is a stub area. Bit 2, if set, indicates that the system is ca- pable of routing IP Multicast datagrams; i.e., that it implements the Multicast Extensions to OSPF. Bit 3, if set, indicates that the associated area is an NSSA. These areas are capable of carrying type 7 external advertisements, which are translated into type 5 external advertise- ments at NSSA borders.

basOspfNbrPriority.name: basOspfNbrPriority
basOspfNbrPriority.description: The priority of this neighbor in the designat- ed router election algorithm. The value 0 sig- nifies that the neighbor is not eligible to be- come the designated router on this particular network.

basOspfNbrState.name: basOspfNbrState
basOspfNbrState.description: The State of the relationship with this Neigh- bor.

basOspfNbrEvents.name: basOspfNbrEvents
basOspfNbrEvents.description: The number of times this neighbor relationship has changed state, or an error has occurred.

basOspfNbrLsRetransQLen.name: basOspfNbrLsRetransQLen
basOspfNbrLsRetransQLen.description: The current length of the retransmission queue.

basOspfNbmaNbrStatus.name: basOspfNbmaNbrStatus
basOspfNbmaNbrStatus.description: This variable displays the status of the en- try. Setting it to 'invalid' has the effect of rendering it inoperative. The internal effect (row removal) is implementation dependent.

basOspfNbmaNbrPermanence.name: basOspfNbmaNbrPermanence
basOspfNbmaNbrPermanence.description: This variable displays the status of the en- try. 'dynamic' and 'permanent' refer to how the neighbor became known.

basOspfNbrHelloSuppressed.name: basOspfNbrHelloSuppressed
basOspfNbrHelloSuppressed.description: Indicates whether Hellos are being suppressed to the neighbor

basOspfNbrChassis.name: basOspfNbrChassis
basOspfNbrChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfNbrSlot.name: basOspfNbrSlot
basOspfNbrSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfNbrIf.name: basOspfNbrIf
basOspfNbrIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfNbrLPort.name: basOspfNbrLPort
basOspfNbrLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basOspfVirtNbrTable.name: basOspfVirtNbrTable
basOspfVirtNbrTable.description: A table of virtual neighbor information.

basOspfVirtNbrRtrId.name: basOspfVirtNbrRtrId
basOspfVirtNbrRtrId.description: A 32-bit integer uniquely identifying the neighboring router in the Autonomous System.

basOspfVirtNbrIpAddr.name: basOspfVirtNbrIpAddr
basOspfVirtNbrIpAddr.description: The IP address this Virtual Neighbor is us- ing.

basOspfVirtNbrOptions.name: basOspfVirtNbrOptions
basOspfVirtNbrOptions.description: A Bit Mask corresponding to the neighbor's op- tions field. Bit 1, if set, indicates that the system will operate on Type of Service metrics other than TOS 0. If zero, the neighbor will ignore all metrics except the TOS 0 metric. Bit 2, if set, indicates that the system is Network Multicast capable; ie, that it imple- ments OSPF Multicast Routing.

basOspfVirtNbrState.name: basOspfVirtNbrState
basOspfVirtNbrState.description: The state of the Virtual Neighbor Relation- ship.

basOspfVirtNbrEvents.name: basOspfVirtNbrEvents
basOspfVirtNbrEvents.description: The number of times this virtual link has changed its state, or an error has occurred.

basOspfVirtNbrLsRetransQLen.name: basOspfVirtNbrLsRetransQLen
basOspfVirtNbrLsRetransQLen.description: The current length of the retransmission queue.

basOspfVirtNbrHelloSuppressed.name: basOspfVirtNbrHelloSuppressed
basOspfVirtNbrHelloSuppressed.description: Indicates whether Hellos are being suppressed to the neighbor

basOspfVirtNbrChassis.name: basOspfVirtNbrChassis
basOspfVirtNbrChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfVirtNbrSlot.name: basOspfVirtNbrSlot
basOspfVirtNbrSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfVirtNbrIf.name: basOspfVirtNbrIf
basOspfVirtNbrIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfVirtNbrLPort.name: basOspfVirtNbrLPort
basOspfVirtNbrLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basOspfExtLsdbTable.name: basOspfExtLsdbTable
basOspfExtLsdbTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12 Link State Adver- tisements
basOspfExtLsdbTable.description: The OSPF Process's Links State Database.

basOspfExtLsdbType.name: basOspfExtLsdbType
basOspfExtLsdbType.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix A.4.1 The Link State Advertisement header
basOspfExtLsdbType.description: The type of the link state advertisement. Each link state type has a separate advertise- ment format.

basOspfExtLsdbLsid.name: basOspfExtLsdbLsid
basOspfExtLsdbLsid.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.4 Link State ID
basOspfExtLsdbLsid.description: The Link State ID is an LS Type Specific field containing either a Router ID or an IP Address; it identifies the piece of the routing domain that is being described by the advertisement.

basOspfExtLsdbRouterId.name: basOspfExtLsdbRouterId
basOspfExtLsdbRouterId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.1 Global parameters
basOspfExtLsdbRouterId.description: The 32 bit number that uniquely identifies the originating router in the Autonomous System.

basOspfExtLsdbSequence.name: basOspfExtLsdbSequence
basOspfExtLsdbSequence.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.6 LS sequence number
basOspfExtLsdbSequence.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It is used to detect old and dupli- cate link state advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number the more recent the advertisement.

basOspfExtLsdbAge.name: basOspfExtLsdbAge
basOspfExtLsdbAge.description: This field is the age of the link state adver- tisement in seconds.

basOspfExtLsdbChecksum.name: basOspfExtLsdbChecksum
basOspfExtLsdbChecksum.description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum. The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connec- tionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum.

basOspfExtLsdbAdvertisement.name: basOspfExtLsdbAdvertisement
basOspfExtLsdbAdvertisement.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12 Link State Adver- tisements
basOspfExtLsdbAdvertisement.description: The entire Link State Advertisement, including its header.

basOspfExtLsdbChassis.name: basOspfExtLsdbChassis
basOspfExtLsdbChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfExtLsdbSlot.name: basOspfExtLsdbSlot
basOspfExtLsdbSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfExtLsdbIf.name: basOspfExtLsdbIf
basOspfExtLsdbIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfExtLsdbLPort.name: basOspfExtLsdbLPort
basOspfExtLsdbLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basOspfAreaAggregateTable.name: basOspfAreaAggregateTable
basOspfAreaAggregateTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2 Area parameters
basOspfAreaAggregateTable.description: A range of IP addresses specified by an IP address/IP network mask pair. For example, class B address range of X.X.X.X with a network mask of 255.255.0.0 includes all IP addresses from X.X.0.0 to X.X.255.255. Note that if ranges are configured such that one range sub- sumes another range (e.g., 10.0.0.0 mask 255.0.0.0 and 10.1.0.0 mask 255.255.0.0), the most specific match is the preferred one.

basOspfAreaAggregateEntry.name: basOspfAreaAggregateEntry
basOspfAreaAggregateEntry.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2 Area parameters
basOspfAreaAggregateEntry.description: A range of IP addresses specified by an IP address/IP network mask pair. For example, class B address range of X.X.X.X with a network mask of 255.255.0.0 includes all IP addresses from X.X.0.0 to X.X.255.255. Note that if ranges are range configured such that one range subsumes another range (e.g., 10.0.0.0 mask 255.0.0.0 and 10.1.0.0 mask 255.255.0.0), the most specific match is the preferred one.

basOspfAreaAggregateAreaID.name: basOspfAreaAggregateAreaID
basOspfAreaAggregateAreaID.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2 Area parameters
basOspfAreaAggregateAreaID.description: The Area the Address Aggregate is to be found within.

basOspfAreaAggregateLsdbType.name: basOspfAreaAggregateLsdbType
basOspfAreaAggregateLsdbType.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix A.4.1 The Link State Advertisement header
basOspfAreaAggregateLsdbType.description: The type of the Address Aggregate. This field specifies the Lsdb type that this Address Ag- gregate applies to.

basOspfAreaAggregateNet.name: basOspfAreaAggregateNet
basOspfAreaAggregateNet.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2 Area parameters
basOspfAreaAggregateNet.description: The IP Address of the Net or Subnet indicated by the range.

basOspfAreaAggregateMask.name: basOspfAreaAggregateMask
basOspfAreaAggregateMask.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2 Area parameters
basOspfAreaAggregateMask.description: The Subnet Mask that pertains to the Net or Subnet.

basOspfAreaAggregateStatus.name: basOspfAreaAggregateStatus
basOspfAreaAggregateStatus.description: This variable displays the status of the en- try. Setting it to 'invalid' has the effect of rendering it inoperative. The internal effect (row removal) is implementation dependent.

basOspfAreaAggregateEffect.name: basOspfAreaAggregateEffect
basOspfAreaAggregateEffect.description: Subnets subsumed by ranges either trigger the advertisement of the indicated aggregate (ad- vertiseMatching), or result in the subnet's not being advertised at all outside the area.

basOspfAreaAggregateChassis.name: basOspfAreaAggregateChassis
basOspfAreaAggregateChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basOspfAreaAggregateSlot.name: basOspfAreaAggregateSlot
basOspfAreaAggregateSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basOspfAreaAggregateIf.name: basOspfAreaAggregateIf
basOspfAreaAggregateIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basOspfAreaAggregateLPort.name: basOspfAreaAggregateLPort
basOspfAreaAggregateLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.
